value.message: Using logger.error for database setup failure may be appropriate, but ensure this is reserved for truly critical failures. If the failure is recoverable or expected, consider using logger.warn instead.
value.suggestion: Review the error handling logic. If the failure is not critical, use logger.warn or logger.info. If it is critical and requires immediate attention (as indicated by process.exit), logger.error is acceptable.

value.suggestion: Rename function to setupKeyValueSchema or initializeKeyValueNamespaces for clarity.
